item.title: Try: run a command & inspect its effects before changing your live system
item.description: - The try command allows users to run a command and inspect its effects before making changes to their live system.

item.title: Russian paramilitary chief says his forces will turn around
item.description: - Yevgeny Prigozhin, the leader of the Wagner mercenary group, has unexpectedly called off his march on Moscow and withdrawn his forces from a military hub in southern Russia.

item.title: Why doesn't TypeScript properly type Object.keys?
item.description: - TypeScript doesn't properly type Object.keys because of TypeScript's structural type system and its behavior with missing and extraneous properties.

item.title: Every Mastodon user has an RSS feed
item.description: - Mastodon is a decentralized social network with 12.8 million user accounts, funded by user donations and run by volunteers.

item.title: A large crash spike affecting Firefox users on Linux
item.description: - There has been a significant increase in crashes affecting users of the Firefox web browser on the Linux operating system.

item.title: $900k Median Package for Engineers at OpenAI
item.description: - OpenAI has a median package of $900k for software engineers, including a base salary of $300k and stock options.

item.title: Take action, Protect end-to-end encryption
item.description: - Worldwide legislation like Chat control, the EARN IT Act, and the Online Safety Bill threatens end-to-end encryption and privacy.

item.title: US vendor accused of violating GDPR by reputation-scoring EU citizens
item.description: - TeleSign, a US-based fraud prevention company, has been accused of violating the EU's data protection rules, specifically the GDPR, by collecting and processing data from millions of EU citizens without their knowledge and consent.

item.title: Common bugs in writing (2021)
item.description: - The post provides guidelines on avoiding common bugs in writing, specifically in technical and academic writing.

item.title: Maker's schedule, Manager's schedule (2009)
item.description: - There are two types of schedules: the manager's schedule and the maker's schedule.
